newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Mobil Singapore says no delay in turnaround.
newsitem.headline: Mobil Singapore says no delay in turnaround.

text.p: Mobil Singapore's, a unit of Mobil Corp of the U.S., refinery maintenance schedule will not be delayed despite a gas leak and two fires at its 280,000 barrel-per-day (bpd) plant, a company spokeswoman said on Tuesday.
"At this moment in time, we do not expect any impact on the maintenance schedule," the spokeswoman said.
The refinery was shut on March 15 for maintenance and debottlenecking to raise its capacity to 300,000 bpd.
Early Tuesday morning, firefighters took 27 minutes to extinguish a fire which involved a large quantity of oil in the production area at Mobil's refinery in Jurong, on the west coast of Singapore.
On Monday, Mobil suspended maintenance work at its aromatics plant following a gas leak which involved one fatality and six others injured.
The refinery also had a flash fire on March 25, which was extinguished in a few minutes.
